alert.note: Alert for Amite (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 1:17PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of St. Helena, northwestern St. Tammany, northeastern Livingston, eastern East Feliciana, Tangipahoa, northeastern East Baton Rouge, southwestern Washington Parishes in southeastern Louisiana and southeastern Amite Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 117 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Darlington to near Folsom. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hammond, Franklinton, Greensburg, Amite, Ponchatoula, Amite City, Kentwood, Independence, Roseland, Albany, Folsom, Montpelier, Enon, Darlington, Wilmer, Natalbany, Robert, Gillsburg, Easleyville and Tangipahoa. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 12 between mile markers 37 and 51. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 28 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
